entities.description: National Survey on Drug Use and Health, a survey to measure the prevalence and correlates of substance use and mental health issues in the United States.
Time frame when the survey is conducted, from 1971 onwards, annually since 1991.
Civilian, noninstitutionalized population of the United States aged 12 or older.
Changes made in 1999 including the switch from national sample design to 50-state design, paper to computer-assisted interviews, and the introduction of CAPI and ACASI.
Changes made in 2002 including renaming the survey and new population data from the 2000 census.
Changes made in 2015 including a partial redesign to improve data quality and an increase in the number of allowable characters in variable names.

relationships.description: Indicates the time period over which the survey has been conducted.
Denotes the population targeted by the survey.
Refers to changes implemented in the year 1999.
Refers to changes implemented in the year 2002.
Refers to changes implemented in the year 2015.
